signature: Helen Goodson, Peer Support Worker, GIS, Sheffield Health and Social Care Trust
body:
Hello Wendy,  
Thank you for your feedback, at Porterbrook we welcome all feedback as it helps us to shape our services for all our clients.  
We can tell you that the Gender Identity Clinic is experiencing significant staffing issues, and this is having a major impact on assessment and follow-up capacity. We are working closely with our senior management team and our commissioner to address the issues and are doing everything we can to address and reduce internal waiting times. We genuinely recognise how frustrating and difficult the waiting times may feel and we assure you that we will endeavour to see you as soon as we possibly can.  
We are unable to comment on individual cases through Care Opinion because it is not always clear whether your Care Opinion name is the same as the one we have on record. However, we assume you are waiting for the next part of your assessment with the comments made. You are welcome to email porterbrook@shsc.nhs.uk to clarify that you are listed for the next part of your assessment.  
Until we are able to see you, if you require support you during this time, you can contact Gendered Intelligence who offer free confidential advice and support to anyone waiting to access our service. You can find out more about the support they offer at genderedintelligence.co.uk or you can contact them using the details below:  
Telephone: 0330 3559 678  
Message/WhatsApp: 07592 650 496  
Email: supportline@genderedintelligence.co.uk

body:
Thank you so much for taking the time to write this Care Opinion, it means a lot to myself and our team and I will be passing this on to everyone.  
Your story and experiences are poignant. In some part myself personally, along with my team were glad we could be alongside you through your husbands illness and after his passing.  
I can only reflect on the inspiration you were to myself and our team, with your commitment to the opportunities for learning we offered, your open mindedness and how you endeavoured to put all the learning, skills and techniques into your own recovery.

Thank you again for taking the time to write this feedback.  
Helen Brown Recovery College Manager

Hello,  
I am sorry to hear of your lengthy transport time from Craigavon Hospital to Lurgan Hospital.  
The nursing staff provide direct person centered care and I am delighted to hear that you have described your experience with the nurses as lovely and pleasant. I will share this positive feedback with the nursing team  
I am sorry that you are finding the meals provided lack variety. I have previously shared this information with the catering team as a concern raised by other patients in regards to menus lacking variety. If you would like your family to bring in some foods that can be stored in the fridge and ready to eat that is no problem.  
We would advise not to have foods that are ready made or that require heating as there poses a frisk of listeria.  
I would like to wish you a speedy recovery and if there is anything else you would like to discuss please contact me on. Donna.oneill@southerntrust.hscni.net

Donna O'Neill

Hello, I'm so sorry you had a disapointing experience after registering at our practice. I'm not sure why you haven't been able to meet your named GP. We regard continuity of care and patients having their own GP as very important. We have had some issues with sickness recently so it's possible that is why you haven't met your GP first. I'm also not sure why when you telephoned the practice, you didn't get a call back. We run a telephone first system for making appointments so expect to ring back everyone that books a telephone appointment. Possibly something went wrong.  
Please do come in to the surgery and speak to the reception manager as she can then make some enquiries and work out what went wrong so that we can improve things. I am also concerned that you felt 'not listened to'. I would be surprised as all our doctors are concerned about our patients and strive to give the best care possible. Again, constructive feedback is very useful as it can help us improve our communications and care we offer. If you would like to come and discuss this further please speak to the reception manager as mentioned about and we can look in to this. Thank you for taking the time to let us know your experience and again, apologies that it was not a good experience for you.
changeMessage: No specific claim has been made

signature: Friends Road Medical Practice
body:
Dear Mr Whyte,

Firstly, we are assuming from the comments below that you are the patient that subsequently saw Dr Karim on 29.6.22 and that your comments were posted online prior to this Face-2-Face consultation.  If this is the case then, as I understand it your concerns have been addressed and are now resolved.  

Irrespective of this, I would like to take this opportunity to apologise for the errors regarding updating your mobile number.  There really is no excuse for why this wasnâ€™t done and I would like to assure you that this matter has been discussed at length with the Reception Team.  Many of the concerns raised below could have been avoided had we updated your medical records with your new mobile number.  As you will now know once we realised that we had not recorded your correct number when you called us on 29.6.22, we immediately typed a letter asking you to contact us to and this letter was hand delivered to your home address on the same day, i.e. at lunchtime on 29.6.22.

Hopefully, this matter has resolved to your satisfaction however, should you wish to discuss this further then please contact the Practice and ask to speak to Jane Passfield, who is our Operations Manager.

Once again, please accept my sincere apologies.

Kind regards

Karen Northwood
Managing Partner
Friends Road Medical Practice

signature: Pinderfields General Hospital
body:
Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent experience.

From what you have described this is not something we would want any of our patients to experience and for that I am sincerely sorry.  It is disappointing to read how you describe a particular member of staff "not being interested" when you questioned your medication.  All our staff aim to communicate clearly and sensitively and I am sorry that was not your experience.

I have shared your feedback with the manager of the service so that they can discuss your experience with the staff and for the negative impact this has had on you.

I am pleased to read that once you were up on the ward your experience was much improved.

If you would like any further help/support, please do contact our PALS team on myh-tr.palsmidyorks@nhs.net.

Thank you again and I hope you are recovering well.

Kind regards
Clare Blackburn
(Head of Patient Experience)

Thank you for taking the time to offer feedback on your visits to the Children's Emergency Department. We have experienced very high demand over recent months and waiting times will vary according to time of day, number of patients already waiting and severity. signature: The Highlands Practice
body:
Dear patient,

Many thanks for your feedback. I am not sure why you have been given this information as I have checked on our system and there are blood tests available at Highlands, Whiteley and Jubilee surgeries next week, the following week and the week after that.

If you would like to phone the surgery to book one of these then a member of our team would be able to help you. Alternatively, if the blood form has already been raised, you are able to book these via digital access.

In response to your concerns about profits, Our practice is a small business, as are all GP surgeries. Sovereign Health Partnership is owned by a partnership of 14 GPs and a Managing Director who are contracted by NHS commissioners to provide services to patients. There are no shareholders. The practice is paid to provide these services and this income is used for liabilities of the practice such as salaries, running costs such as practice bills, repairs and maintenance of the sites, and the partners take their own income too. Your healthcare with us is, of course, provided completely free.

The pandemic has had a significant impact on surgeries up and down the country, and the challenges we are having in terms of demand and complexity are not unique to us. We will continue to work hard to resolve these issues and I hope you will see an improvement in the service we offer very soon.

Many thanks,
Kate

Patient Services Manager
Sovereign Health Partnership

Dear Dr Bromley,

Thank you for taking the time to leave us such wonderful feedback about the care and treatment you received in the Ophthalmology Department at Bexhill Hospital; we really appreciate it.

The Trust strives to provide patients with a high standard of care and treatment at all times, and so we are delighted to read you were very pleased with the cataract treatment you received at Bexhill Hospital. It is also very reassuring for us to read that from the moment you arrived you were treated professionally and with kindness, and staff took the time to explain the procedure with you. This undoubtedly gave you confidence in staff and the procedure you were having, particularly given how important our eyes are to us.

We are very pleased to read you had a trouble-free recovery, and feel confident in returning to us when you have need to return for another eye procedure. Lastly, we hope the cataract treatment has helped to restore or improve your quality of vision.

Take care and keep well.

Good afternoon

Thank you for leaving comments on the NHS Choices Website for the South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.

Thanks also for the post about your positive experience at The James Cook University Hospital when you attended for surgery.   I am sure the staff will be very happy to receive your compliment.  

I am, however, sorry for your discharge delay while waiting for medication from Pharmacy.  

Please contact the Patient Experience Department on 01642 854807 who can help to resolve your issues.  

The service is available Monday to Friday from 9 am to 4 pm excluding bank holidays.  When officers are dealing with other enquirers, you may reach the voicemail. signature: Conquest Hospital
body:
Dear Winston,

Thank you taking the time to leave us some feedback about your recent attendances to the Emergency Department (ED) at Conquest Hospital; we really appreciate it. 

The Trust strives to provide a high standard of care for all patients and whilst we are pleased to read you received good and professional care once seen by clinicians, we are disappointed and sorry to read this was not your experience of staff at the reception desk on either occasion you attended. Please accept our apologies for the concern and upset caused to you. 

We recognise that all staff in our ED's have been under increased pressure due to higher than usual rates of patient attendance as a result of difficulties accessing primary care, such as GP's, but nevertheless, our commitment to treating all patients with kindness, dignity and respect should never falter and we are sorry for your experience of reception staff.

Please be assured our Reception Lead is seeking to identify some customer care training for the reception staff to improve this element of care in the ED's, particularly given they may be the first person a patient, often in pain, worry or distress, will meet.

We hope that you have recovered from the symptoms that led you to attend the ED, and are safe and well.

signature: The Laurels Surgery
body:
Dear Mr Copnall,

Thank you for taking the time to comment on your experience with our surgery, although I was sorry to hear of your difficulties and concerns.

It was a pleasure to speak to you on the telephone yesterday about the issues raised in your review. 

As we discussed, the surgery has an agreement with NHS111 for them to be able to book some appointments directly with us for our patients. I have escalated our shared concern that you were not offered this option when you spoke to our colleagues.

On the day you spoke to us we had only half the usual amount of appointments due to the afternoon closure which all surgeries have for staff training each month. When we have these closures, all our calls are redirected to out-of-hours services. The timings for you were unfortunate and I recognise this felt as though you were being sent back and forth with no help. I was glad to hear when we spoke that you on the mend.

I appreciate that your recent experience was very frustrating and I am sorry that we were not able to be here for you when you needed us. 

Thank you for giving me the opportunity to discuss these difficulties with you directly. I do hope that you feel heard and that our conversation has been able to restore your confidence in the surgery.

Yours Sincerely,
Mrs Alexandra Jones
Practice Manager

Aileen and the Ward 10 Team.

signature: Larkside Practice
body:
Dear Patient
The service you required does not fall under the NHS Remit.  As such this is a paid for service.  A routine letter can cost between Â£30 and Â£50.  Non NHS work has to be undertaken outside of NHS hours by the GP.  Appointments with the GP are booked via a telephone call the to Reception team.  The GP will then call the patient on the nominated day, either am or pm,  and following consultation will decide if a face to face appointment is required and the GP will then book this.  We understand this can be frustrating but this is the current system.  Practice Manager

signature: Larkside Practice
body:
Dear Patient
Thank you for your comments which will be passed onto the whole team.  It is a big morale boost for the team when a patient has taken the time to post a positive comment.  The NHS is under considerable pressure and we endeavour to provide the best service with the resources we have.  Practice Manager

signature: Larkside Practice
body:
Dear Mr Ronan
Thank you for your comment.  Unfortunately, we cannot arrange consultations in this way.  All our patients would like to be able to have such a system but it is not possible.  We have to be able to offer all patients the same service and, therefore all patients are requested to telephone the practice and the team will arrange for a telephone consultation and the GP to call you back on the designated day and time period (AM or PM).   Demand is at an all time high and we are endeavouring to provide the best service we can with the resources we have available.  Should you feel that the practice is not providing you with the level of service you require you are at liberty to register at another local practice of your choice.  Please be assured that the staff all care and will ask for basic details about your condition as the GPs have asked them to do this so the GP can then triage their appointment list.  We regret that we cannot offer a message and ring back service to our patient list.  The team work outside of NHS hours just to help with the daily workload.  Practice Manager
